fields.description:
h3. Summary When editing a page that has a List element that includes

tags, followed by a nested list, followed by more elements from the original list, pressing the return key in the first item (the one with the

tags) will always skip past the nested list and create a new higher level list item. h3. Environment * Chrome Version 43.0.2357.81 (64-bit) h3. Steps to Reproduce # Open Chrome # Install Confluence 5.7.4 # Install the source editor plugin # Create a page and paste the following storage format {code}

  1. Top Level OL Item 1

    Press return at the end of this line

    The carriage return should have created a new line in front of this element as the 2nd element of the top level list.

    But it didn't

     
    1. Nested OL Item 1
    2. Nested OL Item 2
    3. Nested OL Item 3
  2. Top Level OL Item 2 (The carriage return WILL create a new line in front of this element)
  3. Top Level OL Item 3
{code} # Close the Source Editor and hit enter on the directed line h3. Expected Results A 2nd element for the top level list is created after the line the cursor is on h3. Actual Results A 2nd element is created, but it is inserted after the nested list h3. Notes This will normally only occur after pasting a block of content into a list, as using shift+enter to move to a new line without creating a list element uses
instead of placing the text inside of

tags. h3.Solution / Workaround * Use a browser other than Chrome ** Firefox and Safari are not affected by this bug
fields.summary: When editing a page in Chrome, pressing the return key does not always behave as expected

fields.description:
h5. Summary 
[Legacy Atlassian JIRA Directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Connecting+to+JIRA+4.2+or+Earlier+for+User+Management] syncs _inactive_ JIRA users (users without groups and project roles) and indicates them as _active_ users, instead of _inactive_ or _disabled_ users in Confluence instance.

h5. Environment
JIRA: 4.1.2
Confluence: 5.7.4

h5. Steps to Reproduce
# Add new *Legacy Atlassian JIRA (4.2 and earlier)* directory in your *Confluence Administration >> User Directories* page by following the set of instructions available in [Connecting Confluence to JIRA 4.2 or Earlier for User Management|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Connecting+to+JIRA+4.2+or+Earlier+for+User+Management#ConnectingtoJIRA4.2orEarlierforUserManagement-ConnectingConfluencetoJIRA].
(i) Make sure that there's inactive user(s) in the JIRA instance you're trying to connect to.
# Manually syncronise your *Legacy JIRA* directory by clicking *Synchronise* on the *Confluence Administration >> User Directories* page.
# Navigate to *Confluence Administration >> Users*, the inactive user from your *Legacy JIRA* directory will *not* be indicated as a _disabled_ or _inactive_ user. 
# Check the status of this inactive user from the database with the following query.
{code}
SELECT DISTINCT u.lower_user_name, d.directory_name, u.active
FROM cwd_user u
JOIN cwd_directory d on u.directory_id = d.id
WHERE d.directory_name='Legacy JIRA User Database' AND d.active = 'T';
{code}
From the query result, we can see that the user is indicated as _active_ user (_cwd_directory.active = 'T'_).

h5. Expected Results
Upon synchronisation, the inactive users from Legacy Atlassian JIRA Directory should be synced as *_inactive_* JIRA users instead of _active_ JIRA users in Confluence.

h5. Actual Results
Upon synchronisaition, the inactive users from Legacy Atlassian JIRA Directory was synced as *_active_* JIRA users instead of _inactive_ JIRA users in Confluence.
fields.summary: Legacy Atlassian JIRA Directory syncs inactive JIRA users as active users in Confluence.

We use templates a lot and in most cases we use the Create From Template macro to allow users to easily create meeting notes, change requests, test reports, etc.

We are managing one big Confluence space for our project and we have different modules each of them with their own meeting notes, change requests, etc pages.

So, we would like to configure the Create from template button in each module page to add a particular label.

I'm adding a screen shot of a mokcup that may help better understand my request.
fields.summary: Create from template macro should allow to add labels to new page

fields.description:
The recent fix in Confluence 5.7.4 ( -CONF-35004- ) means that on each restart following a plugin update/upgrade/install, Confluence attempts to re-migrate all our "unmigrated" pages (1,800 pages and their attachments) because we have some unknown macros in those pages. These pages seem to get re-migrated again if we update any plugin, enable/re-enable plugins followed by a restart.

This is polluting the change history of the pages because it adds another version on each page. It also appears that the attachments on those pages are getting re-indexed.

I understand the fix may have been intentional but it's having some bad side-effects.

Also related:
 * CONF-35185
 * CONF-32837
 * -CONF-32318-

h2. Workaround

A workaround has been added to the description of related ticket CONF-32837, which provides a method via SQL to disable the remigration job on restarts. As with all database manipulation tasks, please be sure to test this on a non-Production environment first.

In the release of 5.10.8, a system variable is added to turn off the remigration behavior during startup. To use this feature:
 # open CONF_INSTALL_FOLDER/bin/setenv.sh (or setenv.bat under windows)
 # locate "CATALINA_OPTS" and add the below line to the file:
 CATALINA_OPTS="-Dconfluence.startup.remigration.disable=true $ \{CATALINA_OPTS}"
 # save the file and restart tomcat
fields.summary: Confluence remigrates our content on restart if a plugin is updated

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37696].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
Currently Confluence allows to disable including the contents of a watched (and changed) page in the notification emails on a per-user basis (setting it for themselves): [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Email+Notifications].

Alternatively you can disable the function globally: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+Globally+Disable+E-mail+Notifications+with+Page+Content].

In certain cases, such pages may have content that are not to be sent over e-mail, but watchers (may) still receive it.

h4. Proposal
Provide the option to disable sending the changed content of a page on a per-page or per-space basis.

h4. Workaround
It is possible to use a third-party plugin to protect the contents of a page: [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/net.customware.confluence.plugin.vault].
fields.summary: Disable page content in notification per space/page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37692].
  {panel}

We have a Confluence instance where only the tool admin can set restrictions on pages, not users, because we want to keep the information open to anyone.
But when using the "File list" blueprint, the popup window allows the user to set restrictions on the page that will be created.

This breaks the space permissions setup, and furthermore the user cannot remove the restriction once the page is created (because then he does not have the rights to change it...).

There should be a control on the permissions in the blueprint.

This is quite minor, but leads to unecessary tickets to our support team to remove these restrictions.
fields.summary: Users can set restrictions in "File list" blueprint even if the space permissions does not allow restriction settings

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37689].
  {panel}

h5. Problem Definition
As of now in Confluence, the default decorators are stored and loaded from {{<Confluence-Installation>/confluence/decorators}} folder in the installation directory. Should the admin apply their custom layouts by modifying the files on this folder and not from the {{http://<ServerBaseURL>/admin/listdecorators.action}} page on the admin UI page, Confluence will then take these custom changes and indicate it as a {{default}} layout instead. 

Documentation Reference: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Customising+Site+and+Space+Layouts#CustomisingSiteandSpaceLayouts-Advancedcustomisations

\\
h5. Suggested Solution
As a suggestion, it might be better if the default decorators files are not stored in the file system to ensure that the default layout decorators are not modified by the users.
fields.summary: Custom Layouts Modification in Confluence via Overriding Velocity Templates

It would be nice if confluence had a TODO markup, similar to a //TODO: in your code, indicating that some sort of work is needed upon revisit.

I.e. not "go buy groceries" but a todo as in "right here, on this line of documentation, in confluence, this image, what have you, come back later and fix this"

The point being, that some kind of macro would round up all descendants' todos, or some selectable tree (the whole space, whatever) and tabulate them nicely.

For now you can simply label pages that have known issues, mark them up in some noticeable way (red bold angly brackets?  funny green?).

When using confluence for internal documentation, etc. it's quite appropriate to have some ragged stuff, and appropriate to have completely visible "todo"/"fixme" items on there.  People using this public-facing may or may not see the benefit.

fields.description:
When we create a plugin containing a page blueprint and we add the property {{disable-index-page="true"}} at a later stage, this property change is not updated in the database.
The table AO_54C900_CONTENT_BLUEPRINT_AO must be updated when installing the new version of the plugin to set the correct value of the INDEX_DISABLED column.

The only way to work around this issue it to either change the plugin module key or update the mentioned table manually.
fields.summary: INDEX_DISABLED attribute not updated for Page Blueprint plugin modules

fields.description:
Series of spaces are converted to wiki markup as a space followed by a non-breaking space. h3. WYSIWYG Text (note 2 spaces preceding "Smith"): {noformat} Who's going? You and I. Smith too. {noformat} h3. Resulting HTML: {noformat}

Who's going?

You and I.  Smith too.

{noformat} Remaining text in {{noformat}} tag since curly braces were still formatting code. {noformat} Since using two spaces between sentences inserts "  " rather than "  ", sentences that begin after a wrap are indented, which is incorrect. An acceptable fix might be to continue to treat single spaces in the WYSIWYG editor as " " but save double spaces as "  " in wiki markup. Arguably, a better fix still might be to save two spaces in the WYSIWYG editor as the following wiki markup: " " (a single "N" space). {noformat} Either fix would remedy the indent bug and allow for sentence spacing.
fields.summary: Sentence spacing produces unintended indents

*Summary*

JIRA Chart Macro with Two Dimensional shows a scroll bar, although there is enough space on the right side of the macro (see attached JIRAChart.jpg)

*Reproduce*

This is how I reproduced:
# Install vanilla JIRA 6.4.4 and Confluence 5.7.4 (the current latest)
# Create an Applink between them

fields.description:
This was reproduced on 5.7. But probably affects 5.8 as well (for 5.8, the metadata buttons have been moved next to the breadcrumbs as icons).

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a new page from a custom page template
2. Notice that the metadata buttons are visible in the editor footer (location, labels, restrictions)
3. Ensure the page title is empty, then save the page
4. You will get redirected to the editor with the error message "A title must be specified. Please enter a title for this page."
5. Notice that the buttons are no longer present in the footer

Once this happens, there is no way for the user to edit things like page location, restrictions and labels

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37655].
  {panel}

In [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Creating+a+Dedicated+User+Account+on+the+Operating+System+to+Run+Confluence], it is mentioned that:
bq. (!) Do not make the Confluence Installation Directory itself writeable by the dedicated user account.

However, there are known issues which was caused by the lack permissions to the Confluence Home or Installation directories, e.g. [Confluence does not start due to Spring Application context has not been set|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Confluence+does+not+start+due+to+Spring+Application+context+has+not+been+set].

Therefore, could we get this documentation to be updated to ensure that the user running Confluence has full read/write/execute permissions to the Confluence Installation and Home directories?

Thanks.
fields.summary: Update on "Creating a Dedicated User Account on the Operating System to Run Confluence" Documentation

fields.description:
If the plugin system doesn't start up, this is the logging you get by default:

{code}2015-05-14 16:37:19,467 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [atlassian.confluence.upgrade.AbstractUpgradeManager] initialUpgradeFinished Upgrade initial stage completed successfully
2015-05-14 16:37:44,109 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [com.atlassian.confluence.lifecycle] init Confluence is ready to serve{code} 

To get more info, you need to edit your {{log4j.properties}} file, setting the specific package to INFO. (The package is {{com.atlassian.confluence.plugin}}).

This can all be avoided if the logging level is increased by default. Here's an example of the information that is hidden by default:

{code}2015-05-19 11:25:04,556 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [atlassian.confluence.upgrade.AbstractUpgradeManager] initialUpgradeFinished Upgrade initial stage completed successfully
2015-05-19 11:25:04,562 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [atlassian.confluence.plugin.PluginFrameworkContextListener] contextInitialized Confluence is being migrated. Not starting full plugin system.
2015-05-19 11:25:26,778 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [com.atlassian.confluence.lifecycle] init Confluence is ready to serve{code}
fields.summary: Increase the logging level of the reasons for not starting the plugin system

fields.description:
When an email notification for a blog post is sent, and the blog post has a TOC, the links in the TOC aren't formatted correctly. When you click the link, it takes you to the site home page.

For example, the email notification for this blog post contains a TOC:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/2015/05/22/Upcoming+Atlassian+Cloud+upgrade+for+week+starting+24+May+2015

If I click a link in the TOC, I'm taken to the site home page (https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ALLDOC/Atlassian+Documentation) because the link doesn't resolve properly.

When I copy the link, it's trying to send me to an address like this:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/#UpcomingAtlassianCloudupgradeforweekstarting24May2015-JIRA6.5-OD-04

The link should be:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/2015/05/22/Upcoming+Atlassian+Cloud+upgrade+for+week+starting+24+May+2015#UpcomingAtlassianCloudupgradeforweekstarting24May2015-JIRA6.5-OD-04
fields.summary: TOC Links in blog post email not formatted correctly

When setting up Confluence 5.8 on Mac OSX using the embedded H2 database, the following error appears in the logs and setup does not complete:
{code}
2015-05-12 15:28:54,167 WARN [com.mchange.v2.async.ThreadPoolAsynchronousRunner$PoolThread-#1] [mchange.v2.resourcepool.BasicResourcePool] run com.mchange.v2.resourcepool.BasicResourcePool$AcquireTask@3c36ff04 -- Acquisition Attempt Failed!!! Clearing pending acquires. While trying to acquire a needed new resource, we failed to succeed more than the maximum number of allowed acquisition attempts (30). Last acquisition attempt exception: 
 -- referer: http://localhost:8080/confluence/setup/setupdbchoice-start.action | url: /confluence/setup/setupembeddeddb-default.action | userName: anonymous | action: setupembeddeddb-default
org.h2.jdbc.JdbcSQLException: Remote connections to this server are not allowed, see -tcpAllowOthers [90117-176]
	at org.h2.message.DbException.getJdbcSQLException(DbException.java:344)
	at org.h2.message.DbException.get(DbException.java:178)
	at org.h2.message.DbException.get(DbException.java:154)
	at org.h2.message.DbException.get(DbException.java:143)
	at org.h2.server.TcpServerThread.run(TcpServerThread.java:84)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
	at org.h2.engine.SessionRemote.done(SessionRemote.java:606)
	at org.h2.engine.SessionRemote.initTransfer(SessionRemote.java:119)
	at org.h2.engine.SessionRemote.connectServer(SessionRemote.java:430)
	at org.h2.engine.SessionRemote.connectEmbeddedOrServer(SessionRemote.java:311)
	at org.h2.jdbc.JdbcConnection.<init>(JdbcConnection.java:107)
	at org.h2.jdbc.JdbcConnection.<init>(JdbcConnection.java:91)
	at org.h2.Driver.connect(Driver.java:74)
	at com.mchange.v2.c3p0.DriverManagerDataSource.getConnection(DriverManagerDataSource.java:134)
	at com.mchange.v2.c3p0.WrapperConnectionPoolDataSource.getPooledConnection(WrapperConnectionPoolDataSource.java:182)
	at com.mchange.v2.c3p0.WrapperConnectionPoolDataSource.getPooledConnection(WrapperConnectionPoolDataSource.java:171)
	at com.mchange.v2.c3p0.impl.C3P0PooledConnectionPool$1PooledConnectionResourcePoolManager.acquireResource(C3P0PooledConnectionPool.java:137)
	at com.mchange.v2.resourcepool.BasicResourcePool.doAcquire(BasicResourcePool.java:1014)
	at com.mchange.v2.resourcepool.BasicResourcePool.access$800(BasicResourcePool.java:32)
	at com.mchange.v2.resourcepool.BasicResourcePool$AcquireTask.run(BasicResourcePool.java:1810)
	at com.mchange.v2.async.ThreadPoolAsynchronousRunner$PoolThread.run(ThreadPoolAsynchronousRunner.java:547)
{code}

This issue only affects users installing Confluence 5.8.1-RC on Mac OSX and using the embedded H2 (trial) database. 

{panel}
*Workaround*

If you need to set up Confluence 5.8.1-RC1 on Mac OSX (for example, ecosystem developers that want to test their add-ons prior to the release of 5.8) you will need to modify your /etc/hosts file to include your hostname as follows:

1. Ensure that /etc/hosts maps 127.0.0.1 to both localhost and your hostname:
{code}
...
127.0.0.1	localhost <hostname>
::1         localhost <hostname>
...
{code}

2. Purge your local ~/.m2/repository/com/atlassian/confluence directory 

3. Execute: 
{code}
sudo scutil --set HostName <hostname>
sudo scutil --set LocalHostName <hostname>
sudo scutil --set ComputerName <hostname>
dscacheutil -flushcache
sudo shutdown -r now
{code}
(your hostname must be the same for all three variables)
{panel}
fields.summary: Setup wizard fails when creating embedded H2 database on Mac OSX

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37624].
  {panel}

*Current behavior*
Currently page permissions seem to blanket a parent page and its children. If permissions are set on a child page, these permissions apply to the parent as well and vise versa.

*Requested behavior*
When applying permissions to a child page, the parent page should not take on these permissions.

*Use case*
Customer wants parent page to be hidden from anonymous access but wants a child page to be visible. Currently this is not possible in Confluence.
fields.summary: Allow for better handling of child page permissions

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37621].
  {panel}

*Situation*
When adding code blocks to a Confluence page, it is common to collapse the code block macro to save page space. At times, users may want to added a collapsed code block macro inside an expand macro. This does not work as expected when expanding the code block macro.

*Steps to reproduce*

* Create Confluence page
* Add expand macro to the page
* Add code block macro inside of expand macro
* Select the collapsable option
* Save the page
* Expand the expand macro
* Expand the code block macro
* Code block macro opens and disappears


*Expected behavior*

Code should be displayed when expanding the code block macro


*Actual behavior*

Code block macro disappears when expanding



Video attached of this behavior
fields.summary: Collapsed code block macro does not render correctly in parent expand macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37619]. {panel} h3. Summary Creating a user macro with text formatting in Confluence will not work if there is a multiple lines. h3. How to replicate: # Create a user macro like [noprint macro| https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Example+User+Macro+-+NoPrint] (in this example, I have created a redcolor macro) #* Define its Template as {code}## @noparams
$body
{code} # Define its formatting in both (in this example, formatting is giving the font color red and a font size): #* PDF Export Stylesheet #* Space Stylesheet !Capture.PNG! # Call this user macro in a page as so: !Capture1.PNG! # Export this page to PDF h3. What is expected: PDF export is the same as displayed in Confluence page (because of the same formatting defined in Space stylesheet and PDF Export stylesheet) h3. What actually happens: Only the user macro that contains 1 lines work. The one with multiple lines does not have formatting anymore: !Capture2.PNG! h3. Causes One line text with the macro, will return the element: {code}
one line
{code} As you can see, the text "one line" is directly enclosed under the element with the class "redcolor" However if there are more than one line, the text will be enclosed in the

element. {code}

one line

two line

{code} Somehow, the pdf css is not apply to the element which are not directly enclosed in the element class. h3. What CSS formattings are affected: color font-size h3. Workaround: As a workaround, add the following code so

element diretly under the class will be affected by the css {code} .redcolor p { color:red } {code} You will need to add two css in the pdf css so it will work for both of the scenario: !Capture3.PNG!
fields.summary: Multiple lines in user macro breaks its formatting when exported to PDF

fields.description:
We have blog pages which include a blog-post macro.
The blog-post macro searches for a certain label.
The blog itself has the same label.
Therefore, the blog-post macro finds its own page among all the others.
In the log, this message is written:
{noformat}
2015-05-19 15:09:15,600 ERROR [http-8180-46] [plugins.macros.advanced.BlogPostsMacro] execute Already included page RHEL7 Blog, stopping.
 -- url: /display/CDP/2015/03/12/RHEL7+Blog | page: 53772539 | userName: anonymous | action: viewpage
{noformat}

Which is correct so far.  (I hope it doesn't result in a shortened list of search results, though)
But right afterwards there is a Java stack dump
{noformat}
        at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.macros.advanced.BlogPostsMacro.execute(BlogPostsMacro.java:242)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.macro.ContentFilteringMacro.execute(ContentFilteringMacro.java:106)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.macros.advanced.BlogPostsMacro.execute(BlogPostsMacro.java:210)
        at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor4462.invoke(Unknown Source)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:601)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.macro.xhtml.XhtmlMacroManager$ResourceAwareMacroInvocationHandler.invoke(XhtmlMacroManager.java:225)
        at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy2153.execute(Unknown Source)
(etc)
{noformat}
followed by one more line like this:
{noformat}
2015-05-19 15:09:15,622 WARN [http-8180-46] [xhtml.view.macro.ViewMacroMarshaller] marshalInternal Exception executing macro: blog-posts, with message: Already included page RHEL7 Blog, stopping.
{noformat}

Impact: a) fills up the log file unneccessarily
        b) may it cause performance degradation when such blog pages are visited frequentally?

From a user perspective, there is no evidence of the error.
fields.summary: NPE in blog-post upon recursion (.MacroException: Already included page)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37614].
  {panel}

*Current Behavior*
Currently Confluence does not seem to have a timeout when attempting to load macros that are either blocked, or are taking a long time to load. This can lead the end user to a never ending loading page.

*Expected Behavior*
Confluence should set a timeout for the macro to load on the client side, and one the number is met an error should be thrown containing a relevant message.
fields.summary: Add Macro Timeout

fields.description:
The documentation states that by promoting User Created templates, the Blank Page and Blog Post options on the Create dialog are not visible.(see createdialogdocumentation.png)  However, I have promoted all of my custom templates and unpromoted all other templates (see Usrcreatedtemplatelist.png,  blueprinttemplatelist2.png and blueprinttemplates2.png) . I even removed the permission to create blog posts for everyone. 

The Blank Page and Blog Posts are still the first 2 options. (see createdialog.png)

Either the documentation is not correct or this is a bug. Please advise which is the case. 

If the documentation is the issue, I still believe that the Blog Post option should not be visible if no one has permissions to create a blog post.
fields.summary: Create Dialog Incorrectly Displaying Unpromoted Items Before Promoted Items

  {panel}

h6. Situation:
Having more than 2 nested panels in Confluence editor causes difficulties in selection. Observed behavors includes:
* Upon clicking for a location with a cursor, the page jumps and flickers
* Copying and pasting on a parent panel will result in pasted in children panel
* Image Edit Bar does not get displayed

h6. Browser Environment Affected:
* IE 11

h6. Replicated on:
* 5.7.4
* 5.8-OD-50-011

h6. For more information, see screencast attached
fields.summary: Nested Panels Causes Selection Difficulties while using IE

fields.description:
The {{beforeunload}} event warns the user when they may lose changes in their editor, including the comment editor.

Sometimes, you can change the page, or start a new comment with a few characters and it won't trigger the "May lose changes" dialog.

The root cause is {{AJS.Rte.getEditor().isDirty()}}, which [~cpetchell] says is part of TinyMCE and possibly deprecated.

As Don mentioned, it seems like the "dirty" flag is not consistently being set to true if changes are applied to the first paragraph.

Also, please check CONFDEV-26825 for more detailed information about some plugins using {{setContent}} callbacks interfering in how the dirty state gets set.
fields.summary: The method of determining if the editor is dirty is intermittent

Actual:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37601].
  {panel}

h3. User case:

Space was infected by a spamers and inserted thousands of comments with anonymous user and the confluence is very slowly. But now i need to delete all comments from anonymous users of  a space.

h3. Workaround:

!) Backup the database and filesystem before attempting the below SQL. [Production backup strategy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Production+Backup+Strategy] does into detail on the best practice for this. 

Run the following SQL and copy the value of the oldest timestamp from when the spammer started creating comments:

{code}select contenttype, creationdate from content
where contenttype = 'COMMENT'
and creator is null 
order by creationdate{code} 

We'll use this in the following SQL queries where I had the placeholder <TIMESTAMP_OF_FIRST_SPAM>.

The following will remove *all* comments created by anonymous users across the entire Confluence instance created after the timestamp we found in the first SQL query. If needed, we could add a second condition on creationdate to only delete comments created before a certain date if you've had legitimate anonymous comments created since the spam. 

{code}delete from bodycontent where contentid in (select content.contentid from content 
where contenttype = 'COMMENT'
and creator is null
and creationdate >= '<TIMESTAMP_OF_FIRST_SPAM>');

delete from contentproperties where contentid in (select content.contentid from content
where contenttype = 'COMMENT'
and creator is null
and creationdate > '<TIMESTAMP_OF_FIRST_SPAM>');


{code}delete from links where contentid in (select content.contentid from content 
where contenttype = 'COMMENT'
and creator is null
and creationdate >= '2015-05-17 13:42:34.607');{code}

delete from content where contentid in (select content.contentid from content
where contenttype = 'COMMENT'
and creator is null
and creationdate > '<TIMESTAMP_OF_FIRST_SPAM>');{code}
fields.summary: Ability to delete all comments from a space.
